content:
Diagnosis:
Left breast cancer - Grade 3 invasive ductal carcinoma, Stage IIIB (T4N2M0)
ER/PR negative, HER2 positive, PDL1 85%

Previous Treatment:
Completed neoadjuvant chemotherapy with 6 cycles docetaxel/carboplatin/trastuzumab/pertuzumab (TCHP) March-August 2024

Current Situation:
Post-neoadjuvant chemotherapy assessment
MRI breast 12 September 2024 shows partial response with reduction in primary tumor from 6.8cm to 3.2cm
Residual axillary lymphadenopathy

MDT Discussion 15 September 2024:
Case presented with full imaging review. Noted good but incomplete response to neoadjuvant therapy. Discussion focused on surgical approach given initial skin involvement. Consensus reached that patient would benefit from mastectomy and axillary clearance given extent of residual disease. Post-operative systemic therapy plan will depend on final pathology, but likely to include adjuvant T-DM1 given residual disease after neoadjuvant therapy.

Treatment Plan:
1. Proceed to left mastectomy and axillary clearance
2. Consider immediate reconstruction - plastic surgery review arranged
3. Post-operative systemic therapy likely to include 14 cycles of adjuvant T-DM1
4. Consider post-mastectomy radiotherapy depending on final pathology

Next Steps:
Surgical assessment arranged for 22 September 2024
Plastic surgery assessment arranged for same date
Will review again in combined clinic following surgery with final pathology

Patient has been fully informed of MDT recommendations and agrees with proposed plan. She understands the rationale for mastectomy rather than breast conservation and will discuss reconstruction options with plastic surgery team.
